stem: A patient is suspected of having active pulmonary tuberculosis. Which isolation precaution is required?
option_a: Airborne isolation in a negative pressure room
rationale_correct: Tuberculosis is transmitted via airborne particles and requires airborne isolation in a negative pressure room.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct airborne isolation. | B-C: Insufficient for airborne pathogens. | D: Standard precautions alone are not adequate.
exam_logic: Match transmission type to required isolation level.

stem: What is the primary purpose of a negative pressure isolation room?
option_a: Prevent contaminated air from escaping the room
option_b: Protect immunocompromised patients from outside air
rationale_correct: Negative pressure rooms protect staff and others by preventing contaminated air from flowing out of the room.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct containment function. | B: Describes positive pressure rooms. | C-D: Not primary airflow goals.
exam_logic: Determine who is being protected: others or patient.

stem: A respiratory therapist is performing bronchoscopy on a patient with suspected airborne infection. What respiratory protection is required?
rationale_correct: Bronchoscopy is an aerosol-generating procedure and requires airborne-level protection.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct airborne PPE. | B: Surgical mask insufficient for aerosols. | C: Eye protection alone inadequate. | D: Unsafe.
common_trap: Using surgical mask for airborne risk.

stem: What is the foundational principle of standard precautions?
option_a: Treat all blood and body fluids as potentially infectious
option_b: Apply only when infection is confirmed
option_c: Use gloves only when visible blood is present
rationale_correct: Standard precautions assume all blood and certain body fluids may be infectious.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct core concept. | B-D: Misrepresent universal application.

stem: A healthcare worker sustains a needlestick injury from a used needle. What is the immediate first action?
option_a: Wash the area with soap and water
option_d: Ignore if the patient appears healthy
rationale_correct: Immediate washing reduces contamination risk before reporting and evaluation.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct immediate response. | B: Harsh chemicals damage tissue. | C: Aggressive squeezing not recommended. | D: Always report exposure.

stem: Which process completely eliminates all forms of microbial life including spores?
rationale_correct: Sterilization destroys all microbial life including spores.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct definition. | B: Does not reliably eliminate spores. | C-D: Lower levels of microbial reduction.

stem: Why is respiratory hygiene and cough etiquette emphasized in healthcare settings?
option_a: To reduce transmission of respiratory pathogens
rationale_correct: Covering coughs and masking symptomatic patients reduces respiratory pathogen spread.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct infection control goal. | B-D: Not primary purpose.

stem: Which statement about glove use is correct?
option_a: Gloves do not replace hand hygiene
option_c: Gloves can be worn between patients if not visibly soiled
option_d: Gloves are required only for surgery
rationale_correct: Gloves are an adjunct and must be combined with hand hygiene.

stem: Which intervention reduces risk of ventilator-associated pneumonia?
option_a: Elevate head of bed 30 to 45 degrees
option_b: Keep patient flat at all times
rationale_correct: Head-of-bed elevation reduces aspiration risk and VAP incidence.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct evidence-based intervention. | B: Increases aspiration risk. | C-D: Unsafe practices.

stem: A cluster of unusual respiratory infections is identified on a unit. What is the most appropriate action?
option_b: Wait for laboratory confirmation in all cases
option_d: Post on social media to warn others
rationale_correct: Early notification allows investigation and containment.
rationale_why_others_wrong: A: Correct reporting pathway. | B: Delay risks spread. | C: Insufficient response. | D: Violates confidentiality.
